education experience projects blog
40kHz Ultrasonic SONAR

This project involved the design and development of a small two-dimensional SONAR system, using cheap 40kHz ultrasonic sensors and a Teensy 3.6 development board.
Click here for more details.

C++JuliaSignal Processing
Kilojoule Counter: App Design

The goal of this task was to design the user interface for a 'Kilojoule Counter' food and exercise tracking mobile application. A detailed analysis was done into the user's requirements, with a focus on user-centered design. Various features were suggested, and sample screenshots created. Finally, a brief report was prepared, which can be viewed by clicking this box.

FigmaPhotoshopUX Design
Falling Words Game

The task here was to create a 'falling words' game in Java. Importantly, the application was to be multi-threaded, but done so in a safe, predictable way—ensuring good concurrency. Click here to read the project report.

JavaParallel ProgrammingMVC Design
Simulated Helicopter Controller Design

Here, a simulated helicopter control situation was presented, and an analogue controller was built to track a desired height set-point, within certain performance specifications.
Click here to view the final report.

Controller DesignSimulationAnalogue Electronics
Polyphonic Synthesizer using Direct Digital Synthesis on an FPGA

This project involved prototyping a simple audio synthesizer on a reconfigurable computing platform, a Nexys A7 Artix-7 FPGA. This synthesizer was able to play musical tones through an output audio port with specified frequencies, amplitudes, and waveform types. Moreover, multiple tones were able to play simultaneously–i.e. it was polyphonic.
Click here for more details.

VerilogFPGAC++Audio Processing
Smart Greenhouse

The aim of this project was to prototype a simple environment logger—one that could record ambient temperature, humidity, and light, and report these values to a user. Two interfaces were designed: one to be viewed in the Raspberry Pi terminal, and another on a phone running a simple Blynk application. Click here to read the full report.

PythonBlynkRaspberry Pi
Three-dimensional angle-of-arrival localization of sound

The aim of this project was to implement a simple time-difference-of-arrival algorithm that could locate a sound source in three-dimensional space using a tetrahedral microphone array. Thereafter, the accuracy and robustness of this algorithm was analysed. Click here to read the full report.

PythonSignal Processing
Parallel Weather Simulation

This project aimed to investigate the parallel speed-up in a simple weather simulation. It involved a very straightforward weather prediction model, focusing on wind averages and cloud classification. Click here to read the full report.
